domain_prompt:
You are a planning agent in a simplified Blocks World.

Objects & state:
- Labeled blocks: A, B, C, … (rigid, same size).
- One robot hand (the hand) that can hold at most one block.
- A block is always exactly one of: on the table, on top of exactly one other block, or being held.
- A block is clear iff nothing is on top of it.
- The table can hold any number of separate stacks.
- Unless stated otherwise, the hand starts empty.

Legal actions (use these exact action names):
1) pick-up X — Preconditions: hand is empty; X is on the table; X is clear. Effects: hand holds X; X is no longer on the table; X is not clear; hand is not empty.
2) put-down X — Preconditions: hand holds X. Effects: X is on the table and clear; hand is empty; hand no longer holds X.
3) unstack X Y — Preconditions: hand is empty; X is on Y; X is clear. Effects: hand holds X; X is no longer on Y; Y becomes clear; hand is not empty; X is not clear.
4) stack X Y — Preconditions: hand holds X; Y is clear. Effects: X is on Y; hand is empty; hand no longer holds X; X becomes clear; Y becomes not clear.

Invariants:
- No block can be in two places at once.
- A block cannot be both held and on something.
- Only clear blocks can be moved; only clear blocks can receive another block on top; no cycles.

YOUR JOB: Given an initial arrangement and a goal arrangement, return a valid sequence of actions that achieves the goal.

OUTPUT REQUIREMENTS (IMPORTANT): Return ONLY a fenced code block containing one PDDL-style action per line using exactly these names: (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y). Use exactly the object names provided (e.g., A, B, C). No numbering, no extra commentary. Example format:
```
(unstack C B)
(put-down C)
(pick-up A)
(stack A B)
```

problems.prompt: Blocks: A, B, C. Initial: A, B, C are each on the table and clear; hand empty. Goal: A on B and B on C (tower top→bottom: A, B, C). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C. Initial: B on A (A on table); C on table. B and C are clear; hand empty. Goal: A on C and B on A (tower top→bottom: B, A, C). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C. Initial: C on B on A (A on table). C is clear; hand empty. Goal: A on B and B on C (tower top→bottom: A, B, C). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D. Initial: Two towers: A on B (B on table) and D on C (C on table). A and D are clear; hand empty. Goal: Single tower A on B on C on D (top→bottom: A, B, C, D). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D. Initial: D on C on B on A (A on table). D is clear; hand empty. Goal: A on B on C on D (top→bottom: A, B, C, D). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D, E. Initial: A, B, C, D, E are each on the table and clear; hand empty. Goal: E on D on C on B on A (top→bottom: E, D, C, B, A). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D, E exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D, E. Initial: C on B on A (A on table) and E on D (D on table). C and E are clear; hand empty. Goal: Single tower A on B on C on D on E (top→bottom: A, B, C, D, E). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D, E exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D, E. Initial: Three stacks: B on A (A on table), D on C (C on table), and E alone on the table. B, D, E are clear; hand empty. Goal: Single tower C on D on B on A on E (top→bottom: C, D, B, A, E). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D, E exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F. Initial: A, B, C, D, E, F are each on the table and clear; hand empty. Goal: F on E on D on C on B on A (top→bottom: F, E, D, C, B, A). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D, E, F exactly; no extra text.

Blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G. Initial: Two towers: C on B on A (A on table) and G on F on E on D (D on table). C and G are clear; hand empty. Goal: Single tower A on B on C on D on E on F on G (top→bottom: A, B, C, D, E, F, G). OUTPUT: Only a fenced code block with one action per line using (pick-up X), (put-down X), (unstack X Y), (stack X Y); use objects A, B, C, D, E, F, G exactly; no extra text.
